items.message:
River levels remain high today on the River Mole.

Flooding of low lying land, footpaths and roads close to the River Mole and Burstow Stream remains possible throughout today 19 December 2025.

River levels on the River Mole at Horley are high, but falling steadily and are expected to fall throughout today. River levels on the Burstow Stream at Peeks Brook Lane have fallen below the level expected to cause flooding. Further downstream at Bonehurst Road levels remain high but steady and are expected to continue falling throughout today.

After the heavy rainfall cleared yesterday evening, Thursday 18 December 2025, weather conditions are forecast to improve over the next few days and we expect the risk of flooding to reduce gradually over this period.
 
We are closely monitoring the situation and monitoring rainfall and river levels.

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and take care to avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 

This message will be updated by 7:00PM today, on 19 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
items.message:
Flooding is possible today because the Yeo and Parrett rivers levels remain high and expected to continue to rise due to the further rainfall.
Flooding will affect the road from Langport to Muchelney if the drain level at Huish Episcopi pumping station exceeds 7.3m; the road from Muchelney to Long Load above 7.86m; Muchelney to Thorney above 7.93m and Muchelney to Drayton above 8.8m. Property flooding is possible above 8.35m. For the latest river and drain levels refer to https://check-for-flooding.service.gov.uk/river-and-sea-levels.
We are continuing to monitor rainfall and river levels. River Parrett levels are being managed using the Parrett relief channel. We are operating our pumping stations when river levels allow.
Avoid driving, cycling or walking through flood water. Refer to Somerset Council’s website for any local road closures.
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 19 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: This flood alert remains in place. Areas most at risk include low lying land and roads between Melksham and Bathford. The flood gates at Holt Road may be closed. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Semington Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected. River levels are rising with further rainfall (5 to 15mm) is expected  on the 21st December 2025, which will keep river levels high and this flood alert in place. We are closely monitoring the situation and will update this message by 11:30AM on 19 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Middle Stour from Hammoon to Sturminster Marshall
items.message:
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Middle Dorset Stour, Lower Dorset Stour, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around Hammoon, Bere Marsh, Stourpaine, Durweston and Lower Blandford St Mary. River levels have reached 3.0 metres and further flooding is expected throughout the night as river levels continue to rise due to recent rainfall. Levels are forecast to peak around 3.12 metres, at approximately 5:15 AM on the 19th December 2025.
 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
 
This message will be updated by 10:30AM on 19 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

The River Blackwater and Cadnam River are high but slowly falling. Flooding will continue on 19/12/2025, as a lot of rain (42mm) fell on Thursday 19/12/2025. Flooding will continue to affect land, fields, and roads at Cadnam, West Wellow, Landford and Ower throughout today (19/12/2025). Water levels will also be high around the mill building at East Wellow. Only a small amount of rain is forecast over the next 5 days. River levels are expected to return to normal over the next 24 hours. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and will ensure the river is kept free of reported blockages. Avoid low lying roads near rivers‚ which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 11:00 on 20/12/2025.

items.message:

Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Brue, River Sheppey, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around the B3151 Glastonbury to Meare Road.  Overtopping is forecast from the Glastonbury Millstream and the River Brue at North Drain and Westhay. The River Brue is forecast to be bankfull upstream of Bruton Dam with field flooding likely. River levels are expected to fall overnight but further flooding is expected at the weekend as further rain is forecast. 
We are clearing blockages from debris screens and closely monitoring the situation. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . Refer to local authority website for road closure. 
This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 19 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
Following yesterday's rainfall river levels remain high and flooding is continuing on low lying land and roads along the Rivers Eden, Eden Brook and Kent Ditch from Blindley Heath to Penshurst including Edenbridge and Hever. Lingfield and Edenbridge will still be impacted throughout the day. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 6:00pm on 19 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

The Cuckmere River is still rising in Alfriston. Minor flooding could continue to affect fields near North Street and River Lane, Alfriston. In Hellingly, river levels remain high, but are now slowly falling. Minor flooding could continue to affect fields, gardens, and Station Road, Church Lane and Church Road, Hellingly. No significant rainfall is forecast for the next five days. River levels will continue to slowly fall in Hellingly, and begin to fall in Alfriston by 15:00 19/12/2025. River levels should return nearer to normal by Saturday morning in Hellingly and Saturday evening in Alfriston. This message will be updated by 14:00 20/12/2025. We are closely monitoring the situation. Don't put yourself or others at risk. Avoid roads that flood (Mill Lane Church Rd Hellingly, North St Alfriston).

The Western Rother is still high and rising at Fittleworth. Water will be close to Fittleworth Mill from 11:00 on 19/12/2025. River levels in Fittleworth are unlikely to begin to fall before 20:00 on 19/12/2025. At Lodsbridge near Selham river levels remain very high and are expected to be affecting property, but river levels should shortly begin to slowly fall. In Iping and Midhurst river levels are high, and will be causing minor flood impacts to Iping Lane, Stedham Lane, gardens near Iping Bridge, and North Mill, but river levels have already fallen a little from their peak. In Liss and Sheet, river levels have already fallen significantly. Only isolated showers are forecast Friday to Monday. River levels between Liss and Midhurst should return nearer to normal by Saturday. Near Fittleworth, river levels will remain higher than normal through the weekend. We are closely monitoring the situation. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have, including in Lodsbridge and Fittleworth. Avoid roads that flood (Iping). This message will be updated by 12:00 20/12/2025.

Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible for: Lower Rivers Tone and Parrett including West Moor, Hay Moor, Curry Moor, Stan Moor, Salt Moor and North Moor. The River Tone level at Currymoor pumping station remains high. Water is entering Currymoor reservoir via Hookbridge spillway as this level currently exceeds 7.45m. The drain level at Currymoor pumping station is 5.855m. Cutts Road floods when the drain level at Currymoor pumping station is above 5.75m, and New Road when the level is above 6.18m. Please refer to the latest gauge levels on Check for Flooding and Somerset Council’s website for information on road closures in the area. Further rain is expected through Wednesday and Thursday. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Pumping will commence at Currymoor when river levels allow. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 19 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels on Thursday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 18 December 2025 from 21:00, as a lot of rain (43mm) fell on Thursday. 
For 1.5 hours either side of high water (forecast at 22:30), the incoming tide will prevent river from flowing to sea. This may flood the access road and the car park near to the White Swan Pub at Mansbridge. Footpath flooding may also affect Riverside Park. Rain is forecast to continue until 17:00 on 18/12/2025. River levels and flood risk should begin to reduce in Mansbridge after high tide on 18/12/2025. High tide at 10:30 on 19/12/2025 is forecast to be 20cm lower. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and are liaising with Southampton City Council on operation of Woodmill.

items.message: High and rising groundwater levels may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible in the West Dorset area. Groundwater levels are rising in response to recent heavy rainfall. River levels in Wanford have now begun to slowly fall, but near Pallingham Quay river levels are still slowly rising, and not expected to peak until 16:00 on 19/12/2025. In Horsham, river levels have already fallen from their peak, but minor flood impacts are expected to remain affecting gardens of Tanbridge Park, Blackbridge Court, and Arunside School fields. Only isolated showers are forecast Friday to Monday. River levels in Horsham should return nearer to normal by Saturday. Near Wanford, river levels could remain higher than normal until Saturday evening. Near Pallingham Quay river levels could remain higher than normal until next week. We are closely monitoring the situation. Our automatic sluice at Provender Mill is operating to reduce flood risk. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have. Keep flood protection products installed in Wanford, if you have them.  This message will be updated by 14:00 on 20/12/2025.

items.description: Broadbridge Heath to Pallingham Quay on the River Arun
items.message:
High river levels are expected to cause flooding on Thursday. 
Flooding is expected on 18 December 2025 from 23:00, as a lot of rain (30mm) fell on Thursday. 
Flooding will affect fields, gardens and isolated mill and farm properties between Broadbridge Heath and Pallingham Quay. Properties nearer Pulborough such as at Pallingham Lock could be affected from 04:00 on 19/12/2025. Only isolated showers are forecast on Thursday evening, Friday and over the weekend. River levels and flood risk should begin to reduce at Broadbridge Heath by 03:00 on 19/12/2025, and by 18:00 on 19/12/2025 nearer to Pulborough. River levels should return nearer to normal by Saturday near Horsham, but not until next week near Pulborough. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Activate any flood protection products you may have including in Wanford, if you have them. 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 19 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

This is an update to the Flood Warning. High river levels are expected to cause flooding today. 
 
Flooding is expected on 19 December 2025 . 
 
Areas most at risk include Casterbridge Trading Estate, London Road, Mill Street, London Close, Durnover Court and Kings Road in Dorchester. River levels have continued to rise due to recent rainfall and have reached 1.08 metres, river levels are beginning to plateau, but may remain high for several hours. 
 
We are closely monitoring river levels and rainfall levels.
 
Act on your flood plan now, if you have one. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 19 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the Cerne Valley
items.message:
High groundwater levels are expected to cause flooding. 
Flooding is expected from the 19th December onwards. 
Groundwater levels in West Dorset remain high. Areas that could be affected include: Charminster and nearby areas. The groundwater level at the Dickley Down borehole has risen to 170m, and is expected to rise over the next few days. Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. Residents may experience inundation of septic tanks and sewer systems. Flooding of roads is expected, and may have become damaged by floodwater.

Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
If you have a pump, make sure it is working and switched on. Think about alternative power sources in case of power cuts . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.
